data.text:
Silas Thompson is a recurring character in the Freeform series, Good Trouble.

Silas is a protected cult leader whose farm specializes in isolating young women from their families and lives.

Biography[]

Personality[]

Physical Appearance[]

Throughout Series[]

Season 4[]

In What I Wouldn't Give For Love,

In A Penny With A Hole In It,

In Wake Up From Your Reverie,

In This Is Not My Beautiful House,

Season 5[]

In Shot in the Dark,

In Under Pressure,

In I'll Take All the Blame,

In Opening Night,

In I Am Doll Parts,

In Party of One,

In One Way or Another,

In You Can't Always Get What You Want,

In It's All Coming Back To Me Now, Mariana and Joaquin learn from Adam that Madison's body might be buried on the farm. She was in a sweat lodge with the other girls when Silas forced her to stay inside. The witness saw Silas digging a grave behind the house. Mariana and Joaquin take their evidence to Detective Briggs who gets a warrant. Briggs, Mariana, and Joaquin head to the farm with a cadaver dog. The CSU unearths a coyote skeleton. The warrant only covers that specific area. Silas hopes this gets Mariana and Joaquin get closure because he's done being harassed. Joaquin calls Jenna and sees Silas checking the ringing phone. He figures out Jenna is there. He runs inside to search for his sister. He finds her in a room. He drags her out of the house against her protests. Jenna admits she came back to the farm. She's happy there, safe, and with Silas. She refuses to come with him and Joaquin flips out. The cops keep him back as he tells the girls about the sex tapes, money laundering, jail time, and that Silas isn't a messiah. Briggs tells Joaquin to accept his sister's choices. Jenna and the girls flock to Silas, who explains Joaquin is gripped by evil and will be in their prayers. Joaquin and Mariana must leave the farm.
